message: Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product. I believe it has the potential to revolutionize your business.  My starting price is $2000000, but I'm open to discussing a mutually beneficial deal.
Alice,  $2000000 is significantly higher than my budget. While I appreciate the product's potential, I'm only able to offer $800000 at this time. This is my maximum price point.

Bob, I understand your budget constraints. While $800000 is significantly lower than what I initially proposed, I'm willing to be flexible. I'm prepared to lower my price to $1700000, reflecting the unique value proposition of this product.  Let's find a compromise that works for both of us.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. While $1700000 is closer, it's still outside my acceptable range. I'm firm on my previous offer of $800000. This is the absolute maximum I can afford, and I believe it's a fair price considering the potential of the product. I'm confident that we can reach a mutually beneficial agreement.

Bob, I hear your perspective and appreciate your continued interest in the product. While $800000 is unfortunately too low for me, I'm willing to make another concession.  To demonstrate my commitment to finding a solution, I'm prepared to lower my price to $1600000.  This represents a significant discount from my initial offer, but reflects the unique value this product can bring to your business. Let's work together to finalize a deal that benefits both of us.

Alice, I appreciate your continued willingness to negotiate. However, $1600000 is still significantly outside my budget.  I'm sticking to my offer of $800000. It's my absolute maximum.  If you're not willing to accept this, I will need to explore other options.  Time is of the essence for me, so let's find a solution quickly.
